description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b6mjb","text":"Human Tumor Atlas Tissue MicroArrary TNP  (TMA-TNP)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4a3ep","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"35sqg","text":"The Tissue MicroArray (TMA) TNP will extend the  SARDANA-TNP characterization and analytics methodologies for evaluation and validation on a large array of breast tumor samples that provide a broad spectrum of disease state and subtype. A commercially available anonymized breast tumor TMA was purchased and sections distributed to participating HTAN Centers. Some deidentified basic clinical data will also be provided. The participating HTAN Centers will characterize the FFPE specimens (e.g. by imaging) and generate a spatially resolved cell type/state census using each Center’s method of choice. Data will then be recorded in a common repository to enable joint analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"erklp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6rn3g","text":"This TNP has two specific Aims focused on (i) Data Collection and (ii) Data Coordination and Analysis. Individual Centers can participate in one or both aims.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4bbat","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2on1c","text":"The custom TMA design for this project was generated by Dr. Koei Chin (OHSU) and sent to Pantomics for custom TMA FFPE block generation and sectioning.  The TMA design and clinical sample descriptions can be found here:  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d28to","text":"dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bn2fmgbn .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":41}],"data":{}},{"key":"16snk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9o9q0","text":"This protocol describes the procedure by which the OHSU OMS Atlas HTAN Center sectioned and distributed TMA sections for Phase 3 analysis.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"204025CCB06211ECBCB00A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://dx.doi.org/10.17504/protocols.io.bn2fmgbn"}}}}

fork_info.title: TMA-TNP  Section Map and Slide Processing - Phase 3

keywords: biospecimen, FFPE, tissue processing, spatial mapping

materials.name: Tanner Scientific 45° White Adhesive Slide with Beveled Edge

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"crjf8","text":"Verify the identity of the FFPE block to be cut against written request for sectioning.  The FFPE block (TMA1) will be utilized for TMA-TNP Phase 3.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c6jkj","text":"Each slide was labeled with a  unique OHSU Slide ID corresponding to the FFPE section map {"blocks":[{"key":"e5mfd","text":" Align block on microtome to minimize tissue loss.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"4nfii","text":"Face into block at 5μm until full section of tissue is achieved.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"b0ui9","text":"Cut adequate ribbon at 5μm to cover all serial sections.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"824u7","text":" Mount tissue sections onto Tanner slides to maintain serial order and orientation of sections.  Sections for Nanostring must be placed in a shifted orientation to capture the cores of interest (2 sections/slides to be combined for full representation of TMA1).  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dqkgm","text":"All Slides are immediately baked in a   oven  (~45-48C) for 2 hours prior to distribution.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":38,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"3umqi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"guid":"8E94C1CD1DFF11EB875B0A58A9FEAC2A","id":"47818","label":"","temperature":"45","unit":10}}}}

","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":48,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":51,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":103,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":110,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"13mbd","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5q8n0","text":"Note: Slides should be baked at   for at least 30
